javadoc: Helper class to manage actions on the File menu.

methods.javadoc: creates all the menu items for the File menu
methods.name: createActions
methods.comment: creates all the menu items for the File menu

methods.javadoc: Create a new project using a wizard to get the project information.
methods.name: newProject
methods.comment: Create a new project using a wizard to get the project information.

methods.javadoc:
Opens the given project in a task that will show a dialog to block input while opening
 the project in the swing thread.
methods.name: openProject
methods.comment:
Opens the given project in a task that will show a dialog to block input while opening
 the project in the swing thread.

methods.javadoc:
Open an existing project, using a file chooser to specify where the
 existing project folder is stored.
methods.name: doOpenProject
methods.comment:
Open an existing project, using a file chooser to specify where the
 existing project folder is stored.

methods.name: lockDomainObjects
methods.comment:
Obtain domain objects from files and lock.  If unable to lock 
 one or more of the files, none are locked and null is returned.

return.comment:
locked domain objects, or null if unable to lock
 all domain objects.

methods.name: closeProject
methods.comment:
menu listener for File | Close Project...
 
 This method will always save the FrontEndTool and project, but not the data unless 
 confirmClose is called.

params.name: isExiting
params.comment:
true if we are closing the project because 
 Ghidra is exiting

return.comment: false if user cancels the close operation

methods.javadoc: menu listener for File | Save Project
methods.name: saveProject
methods.comment: menu listener for File | Save Project

methods.javadoc: menu listener for File | Delete Project...
methods.name: deleteProject
methods.comment: menu listener for File | Delete Project...

methods.javadoc:
Checks the list for read-only files; if any are found, pops up
 a dialog for whether to save now or lose changes.
@param files list of files which correspond to modified 
 domain objects.
@return true if there are no read only files OR if the user
 wants to lose his changes; false if the user wants to save the
 files now, so don't continue.
methods.name: checkReadOnlyFiles
methods.comment:
Checks the list for read-only files; if any are found, pops up
 a dialog for whether to save now or lose changes.

return.comment:
true if there are no read only files OR if the user
 wants to lose his changes; false if the user wants to save the
 files now, so don't continue.

methods.javadoc:
Fire the project opened event
@param project project being opened
methods.name: fireProjectOpened

methods.javadoc:
Fire the project closed event.
@param project project being closed
methods.name: fireProjectClosed

name: FileActionManager
comment: Helper class to manage actions on the File menu.
